subject: RE: CLARIFICATION - Option A: Replace Express BE with new AF app
body:
Hi Sarah,

Great question! The answer is **Option A**.

## What's Happening

We're replacing the **Express BE** (NEXT_PUBLIC_BE_URL) with the new Azure Functions app (calendar-be-af).

| Variable | Current | After Cutover |
|----------|---------|---------------|
| NEXT_PUBLIC_BE_URL | Express BE (calendarbe.tangotiempo.com) | AF (calendarbeaf.azurewebsites.net) |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_AF_URL | AF (tracking, geo, etc.) | **NO CHANGE** |

## Why

The Express BE (calendar-be) is being migrated to Azure Functions (calendar-be-af). Same endpoints, same functionality, just running on Azure Functions instead of Express.

## What You Already Use from AF (NEXT_PUBLIC_AF_URL)

These endpoints stay exactly where they are - **NO CHANGE**:
- /api/visitor/track
- /api/user/login-track
- /api/user/mapcenter-track
- /api/mapcenter
- /api/geo/*
- /api/health/mongodb

## What's Moving to the New AF (NEXT_PUBLIC_BE_URL)

These endpoints move from Express to new AF:
- /api/events
- /api/venues
- /api/organizers
- /api/categories
- /api/roles
- /api/userlogins

## Summary

- NEXT_PUBLIC_BE_URL: Changes from Express â†’ new AF app
- NEXT_PUBLIC_AF_URL: No change at all

Does this clarify?

- Fulton
